content: @nikomatsakis I want to make sure we're on a good foot for the this change. The big issue with the RFC is not whether the end goal is acceptable but how do we migrate. We can continue to hash that out on the RFC and in the zulip thread, but I want to see how we're feeling about getting this RFC to a good place by the end of the month which is our soft deadline for inclusion in the 2021 edition. Do we see that as realistic?
I thkn we could accept the RFC with a bit of an unresolved question on some of the migrations
what we really need is somebody to commit to doing the engineering work
I was considering trying to persuade @Santiago Pastorino to do this
but somebody like @Zack M. Davis might be good too, if they were interested
or we could put out a bit of a call :)
I can take the work, unless @Zack M. Davis is interested, just let me know :)
Iâ€™d be interesting in helping with the work but not sure I can commit to doing it all.
FWIW, I can try to help / assist a bit too
Ok if we have 3-4 people who can work on this, then we need to make a decision if the full deprecation of textual scope macros in Rust2021 is too disruptive or not.
@nikomatsakis going to start reading the issue in a couple of hours and try to see if I can do some work
more than happy if people want to share some work or help :), cc @rylev @Daniel Henry-Mantilla
